territory.notes: Initially established as the Tukulor Empire around 1852 by El Hadj Omar Tall. Tall gradually defeated and subsumed the Kingdoms of Kaarta, Macina, and Ségou. With the defeat of Ségou in 1862, the Tukulor Empire also became known as the Ségou-Tukulor Empire, which is consistent with the developments following Tall’s death in 1864: his son Amadou Tall succeeded him in Ségou, continuing the Tukulor Empire there. However, Amadou Tall was never able to control Macina or Kaarta, which were ruled by his brothers and other relatives who never fully recognized his supremacy. The Ségou-Tukulor Empire ultimately collapsed after being gradually defeated by the French by 1893.
